intro: Ariosorbus mougeotii, commonly known as the Sierra madre currant, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Grossulariaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and edible berries. The plant typically grows in rocky, dry habitats, such as cliffs and slopes. Its leaves are alternate and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are usually pink or white. The berries, which are red when ripe, are used both for food and in traditional medicine by indigenous peoples.
